root.hap.cluster

Class ClusterReducer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.Reducer<org.apache.hadoop.io.Text,org.apache.hadoop.io.Text,org.apache.hadoop.io.Text,org.apache.hadoop.io.Text>
      • root.hap.cluster.ClusterReducer

  • public class ClusterReducer
extends org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.Reducer<org.apache.hadoop.io.Text,org.apache.hadoop.io.Text,org.apache.hadoop.io.Text,org.apache.hadoop.io.Text>

    Reducer class for extracting clusters.

    This reducer takes in a set of rows and diagonals from the HAP algorithm generated matrices and uses their contents to extract cluster descriptions.

    Input key [Text]: information about these rows
    Input value [Iterable<Text>]: the corresponding rows

    Output key [Text]: ignored, not used
    Output value [VectorWritable]: tab separated list: {Exemplar ID, Vector ID, Level}

    Since:
    2013.06.25
    Author:
    Dillon Rose, Michel Rouly
    See Also:
    HierarchicalClusterDriver, ClusterReducer

      • reduce

        public void reduce(org.apache.hadoop.io.Text keyIn,
          java.lang.Iterable<org.apache.hadoop.io.Text> valIn,
          org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.Reducer.Context context)
            throws java.io.IOException,
                   java.lang.InterruptedException

        This method serves to extract cluster data by accessing a single row and the diagonal of each matrix. Diagonal values are used to determine if the exemplar is in a valid location (specifically if the diagonal value is positive).

        Overrides:
        reduce in class org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.Reducer<org.apache.hadoop.io.Text,org.apache.hadoop.io.Text,org.apache.hadoop.io.Text,org.apache.hadoop.io.Text>
        Parameters:

        valIn - vector data
